ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I significantly improved my writing level and was exposed to a lot of eye-opening reading material and subsequent class discussions on those readings. I developed a new appreciation for writing and readings and felt that it was one of the best classes I've taken so far in every sense.
I really was able to hone in on my writing skills.
I learned how to closely read and annotate an essay in order to better identify and later utilize various writing techniques.
Writing a college essay, multiple styles of writing and essay formatting, close reading techniques
Different forms of creative writing, how to read/analyze an essay, peer review
I became a much better writer and reader.
This class really improved my writing. From the beginning to the end there was a drastic improvement. It also really helped me improve my revision skills.
I learned a lot about how to structure my writing by the sentence and look closely at structure. Also learned to write with different focuses on mind such as place, person, experience, etc
this course greatly improved my writing and reading skills
I learned new writing styles and ways to create a dynamic and interesting story.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I don't see any weaknesses; the strengths were the broad range of reading materials and essay topics
I was sad that our class and not have a humor S at the end but otherwise I really loved every paper that we wrote

This was an excellent writing course -- I took it because I needed a writing credit, and was surprised at how much I enjoyed it. I do think the weekly discussions would be more engaging if they were fifty minutes instead of seventy-five.

This course is amazing. I love the structure of the 5 essays, and I wish we couldve written  the satire essay they used to have in this course! I thought the argument and cultural commentary were very similar. My favorite by far was the profile essay, both reading and writing in that unit. American Man Age 10 might be my favorite essay of all time. I like the opportunity for peer review on one essay, and workshop days were always so fun. Annas feedback was also very helpful and she is the biggest strength to the class.
Overall, this class was great. I do wish there was more of an opportunity to talk about our writing with our peers.

Strengths: the workshops were so awesome and so helpful, didnt feel like criticism at all and rly good vibes

Weaknesses: I wish I could have gotten class opinion on more of my writing. I know at the end of the semester we talked about a discussion board to share writing which could be a good idea to structure a little more next time.
strengths were group discussion and great teacher and peer feedback but weakness was that i felt the discussions went on for too long about one specific piece of writing
Some strengths were the quality and variety of readings that we had to do. The timing of the essays was also useful and provided enough time to work on a draft and make a quality final draft.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, for the reasons above
Yes, I would recommend this to anyone looking for a writing credit. The assignments are straightforward and most of the readings are interested. Grading is a little rough, but it always seemed fair.
YES!! 100 times over.
There is no course like this at yale. Unbelievable investment in the students and their writing from the teacher.
Absolutely! I loved the structure of the course. I really enjoyed writing the essays. Anna was a wonderful instructor!
Take this class! It should be required for all Yale students. My writing became so much better and it is a great opportunity for self reflection.
Yes, super helpful in developing creating nonfiction writing and you get exposed to a lot of really cool writers
yes! really great to write personal essays and grow as a writer
Yes i would highly recommend this course to another student because it was enjoyable and allowed me to write more creatively.
